responses.content:
```yaml
leads:
  - headline: Insecure default service name for PAMSecurityRealm
    analysis: |
      The PAMSecurityRealm class uses a default service name of "sshd" if no service name is specified. This could potentially allow an attacker to bypass authentication if they can compromise the sshd service.
    cwe: CWE-306
    function_names:
      - PAMSecurityRealm
    filenames:
      - src/main/java/hudson/security/PAMSecurityRealm.java
    classification: slightly promising
  - headline: Case sensitivity issue with user/group names on OS X
    analysis: |
      On OS X, the PAMSecurityRealm uses a case-insensitive ID strategy. This could lead to authorization bypass vulnerabilities if case sensitivity is not handled properly in other parts of the application. For example, an attacker could create a user or group with the same name as an existing user or group, but with different casing.
    cwe: CWE-178
    function_names:
      - <none>
    filenames:
      - src/main/java/hudson/security/PAMSecurityRealm.java
    classification: not promising
```

leads.headline: Insecure default service name for PAMSecurityRealm
leads.analysis: The PAMSecurityRealm class uses a default service name of "sshd" if no service name is specified. This could potentially allow an attacker to bypass authentication if they can compromise the sshd service.

leads.headline: Case sensitivity issue with user/group names on OS X
leads.analysis: On OS X, the PAMSecurityRealm uses a case-insensitive ID strategy. This could lead to authorization bypass vulnerabilities if case sensitivity is not handled properly in other parts of the application. For example, an attacker could create a user or group with the same name as an existing user or group, but with different casing.
